result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quatrion L Morens

records.addlTxt:
9:16 AM Defendant Quatrion L Morens in court.  Attorney Christopher S. Hammond in court for Quatrion L Morens.  Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Defense states that defendant is looking into retaining private counsel and requests status in 60 days.
Court inquires if defendant has tested with RCAP.
Defendant has not, case will be passed with defendant to return forthwith with his RCAP test results.

CASE RECALLED AT 9:50 A.M. - SAME APPEARANCES.
Defendant has tested with RCAP with all negative results.
Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

BTC: Court to appoint counsel at a repayment of $ 10 a month to start in 90 days.

from SPD, no attorney appointment as of today.

Defendant is in custody in RCJ, refused court this morning.
BTC: Matter adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on March 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:37 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Quatrion L Morens appeared in court, in custody. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Deft does not have counsel. 

BTC: Good cause found to waive time limit, set for a status.
Status conference scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on February 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. Absolute sobriety. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Quatrion L Morens appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Alexander J. Kostal appeared in court for Quatrion L Morens. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 13, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 13, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Initial appearance on January 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
